document_title: Vertebral collapse: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
In fact, about two-thirds of spinal compression fractures go undiagnosed because they do not cause obvious symptoms or signs. Many people even mistake it for back pain caused by age and arthritis.
The main clinical symptoms of vertebral collapse include any of the following, either alone or in combination:
Sudden onset of back pain; Pain increases when standing or walking; Pain intensity decreases when resting; Spinal mobility is limited; Reduced height, hunchback; Spinal deformity and disability
